title: Nvidia Hits Record $4 Trillion Market Cap Amid AI Boom
snippets: Nvidia topped a $4 trillion market cap for the first time as investors scooped stock in the tech giant building the hardware for the generative AI boom.
Maker of AI chips has led a sharp rebound for tech shares on Wall Street

Ongoing surge in demand for AI technology fueled stratospheric rise of chipmaker’s value

Chipmaker Nvidia became the first public company in history to scale a $4tn market value on Wednesday as its stock price continues a years-lo
Shares of the AI chip king have soared nearly 35,000% over the past 10 years.
The chip maker’s stock touched an intraday level needed to achieve a $4 trillion market cap, but has since pulled back slightly.
This marks a stunning rebound following a rough start to the year for the AI chipmaker

NEW YORK (AP) — Chipmaker Nvidia became the first public company to top $4 trillion in value Wednesday after a two-year investor frenzy driven by the artificial intelligence boom. Nvidia shares rose 2.5%, in early trading Wednesday, topping $164 each. At the beginning of 2023, Nvidia shares were aro
titles: Nvidia hits $4 trillion market cap, first company to do so
Nvidia becomes first company to reach $4tn in market value
Nvidia becomes first company to reach $4tn in market value
AI Titan Nvidia Becomes First $4 Trillion Company Ever
Nvidia briefly becomes the first $4 trillion company. How it beat Microsoft and Apple to the crown.
Nvidia first company in history to hit US$4 trillion in market value
Chipmaker Nvidia becomes most valuable company in the world at $4 trillion
summary: Nvidia reached a $4 trillion market cap, a first for any public company, driven by a surge in demand for its AI chips amid the generative AI boom. This milestone reflects a significant rebound in tech shares, with Nvidia's stock soaring nearly 35,000% over the last decade. Despite a brief pullback from its peak intraday level, the achievement marks a dramatic recovery from earlier in the year. The company's shares were trading up 2.5% early Wednesday, indicating robust investor enthusiasm for the leading AI chipmaker.
constructiveness_reason: This story clearly highlights progress in the tech industry, specifically Nvidia's growth and the rise of AI. It provides useful information that can help readers understand the current state of the tech market and the role of AI in driving growth.

title: Holmgren Secures $250M Max Rookie Extension with Thunder After NBA Win
snippets: Oklahoma City Thunder and centre Chet Holmgren agree to contract extension worth up to a quarter of a billion dollars.
Thunder star Chet Holmgren has agreed to a fully guaranteed five-year maximum rookie contract extension that could reach $250 million, Bill Duffy of WME Basketball told ESPN on Wednesday morning.
Oklahoma City's center is here to stay after an NBA Finals victory over the Indiana Pacers
The Thunder have locked up Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Chet Holmgren so far this summer, Jalen Williams is up next.

title: Red Bull Sacks Horner After 20 Years, Appoints Mekies as New Team Principal
snippets: Christian Horner is sacked as Red Bull team principal after 20 years in the role.
Christian Horner is sacked as Red Bull team principal after 20 years in the role.
Christian Horner's tenure as the longest-serving F1 team principal came to an abrupt and unexpected end on Wednesday.
Red Bull boss exits the team after a stellar two decades that yielded eight Formula One Drivers' World Championships.
After 20 years at the top of Formula One and more than a year since a misconduct investigation, Christian Horner is out.
Exit comes a year after allegations of inappropriate behaviour towards a female employee were dismissed
Christian Horner has been sacked by Red Bull after 20 years as team principal, the team confirmed on Wednesday.
Max Verstappen broke his silence after Christian Horner was released by Red Bull.

• Laurent Mekies appointed as Horner’s replacement

  • Red Bull have had turbulent time on and off track

Christian Horner has been sacked as Red Bull team principal with immediate effect. Horner, who has been in charge of Red Bull since the team was formed in 2005
Defending Formula 1 champion Max Verstappen has declined to comment on his future with Red Bull beyond 2025.
Christian Horner admitted his sacking as Red Bull team principal had come as a "shock" as he made a tearful farewell speech at the team's factory.
Sky Sports' Craig Slater is joined by F1 commentator David Croft to discuss the timeline of how Christian Horner's sacking as Red Bull's team principal came about.
Longtime Red Bull team principal Christian Horner was fired abruptly on Wednesday after a 20-year stint that included eight Formula 1 drivers’ titles and a rise to celebrity status.

summary: Christian Horner has been sacked as Red Bull's team principal after 20 years, a tenure marked by eight Formula 1 Drivers' World Championships. The decision, described as abrupt and shocking by Horner himself, comes a year after allegations of inappropriate behavior were dismissed. Laurent Mekies has been appointed as his replacement. The team has experienced both success and controversy during Horner's leadership. Defending champion Max Verstappen has not commented on his future with the team beyond 2025.
constructiveness_reason: The story informs about the change in leadership at Red Bull's team, which provides useful context for followers of Formula 1. However, it doesn't delve into the potential impacts of this change or provide insights into the reasons behind the decision, limiting its constructiveness.

title: Bencic and Swiatek Reach First Wimbledon Semi-finals
snippets: Switzerland's Belinda Bencic stunned teenager Mirra Andreeva to reach a maiden semi-final at Wimbledon, where she will face eighth seed Iga Swiatek.

Belinda Bencic, playing in her first Wimbledon quarterfinal in nine appearances at the All England Club, upset Russian teen sensation Mirra Andreeva 7-6 (3), 7-6 (2) on Wednesday to reach her second Grand Slam semifinal and first in six years.
Iga Swiatek smashed through her grass ceiling as she reached the Wimbledon semi-finals for the first time against Tokyo Olympic champion Belinda Bencic.

Iga Swiatek reached the Wimbledon semifinals for the first time with a 6-2, 7-5 victory over 19th-seeded Liudmila Samsonova that went from a stroll to a bit of a struggle in the late stages Wednesday.
titles: Bencic stuns Andreeva to set up Swiatek semi-final
Bencic shocks No. 7 Andreeva at Wimbledon
Swiatek smashes grass ceiling to set up semi-final with unseeded Bencic
Iga Swiatek, Belinda Bencic set to clash in Wimbledon semis
summary: Belinda Bencic reached her first Wimbledon semi-final and second Grand Slam semi-final in six years by defeating Mirra Andreeva 7-6 (3), 7-6 (2). This marks her first Wimbledon quarterfinal win in nine attempts. She will face Iga Swiatek, who also advanced to her first Wimbledon semi-final by beating Liudmila Samsonova 6-2, 7-5. Swiatek's victory came after overcoming a challenging late stage in the match.
constructiveness_reason: This story provides useful information about the progress of the Wimbledon tournament, specifically the achievements of Belinda Bencic and Iga Swiatek. However, it does not offer deeper insights into their strategies, challenges, or the implications of their success.

title: Astronomers Discover Pebbles Key to Planet Formation Around Young Stars

titles: Astronomers Catch Planets in the Act of Being Born
Astronomers Spot “Death Wish” Planet That’s Slowly Killing Itself
summary: Astronomers have discovered centimeter-sized pebbles orbiting two young stars 450 light-years away, using the UK's e-MERLIN radio array. This observation, part of the PEBBLeS project, marks a significant find in understanding planet formation, as these pebbles are the early building blocks of planets and are seen extending to orbits similar to Neptune's. This discovery provides unprecedented detail into the initial stages of planet formation around infant stars.

title: Cardinals, Giants, Padres, Guardians, and Rangers Secure Wins in MLB Games

Brendan Donovan and Lars Nootbaar both knocked home runs as the St. Louis Cardinals defeated the Washington Nationals 4-2.

Patrick Bailey pulled off a three-run, inside-the-park home run, Robbie Ray struck out five batters and pitched into the sixth inning, and the San Francisco Giants took a 4-3 win over the Philadelphia Phillies.
Luis Arraez brought the offence with a solo homer and the San Diego Padres pitching staff provided the defence, allowing just three hits in a 1-0 shutout win over the Arizona Diamondbacks.
Angel Martinez crushed a go-ahead grand slam in the 10th inning to lift the Cleveland Guardians to a 10-6 win over the Houston Astros in extras.
Jake Burger had a monster day with three hits, four RBIs and a solo shot, Wyatt Langford added four RBIs of his own with a two-run homer, and the Texas Rangers dominated the Los Angeles Angels 13-1.
Ryan Jeffers had three hits and three RBIs, including a two-run shot, Harrison Bader added a two-run homer of his own, and the Minnesota Twins crushed the Chicago Cubs 8-1.
Francisco Lindor and Pete Alonso both knocked homers in the eighth inning and Juan Soto slapped an RBI single for the go-ahead run as the New York Mets topped the Baltimore Orioles 7-6 in extras.
Sal Frelick bashed a solo homer and Jacob Misiorowski struck out 12 over six innings as the Milwaukee Brewers topped the Los Angeles Dodgers 3-1.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a three-run blast, Austin Wells added a two-run homer, and the New York Yankees cruised to a 10-3 win over the Seattle Mariners.
Bryan Bello struck out 10 in a complete game effort, and Trevor Story drove in four runs, including a three-run bomb, as the Boston Red Sox trounced the Colorado Rockies 10-2.

Colt Keith led the way on offence with three RBI, including a two-run shot, and Jack Flaherty struck out eight over 6.2 innings as the Detroit Tigers won their second straight over the Tampa Bay Rays 4-2.

title: Canada Revokes Ozempic, Wegovy Patents Over Unpaid Fees
snippets: Novo Nordisk will lose its patent protection on its branded semaglutide drugs Ozempic and Wegovy in Canada after not paying a maintenance fee in 2019.

summary: Novo Nordisk's patent protection for its semaglutide drugs, Ozempic and Wegovy, in Canada has been revoked due to the company's failure to pay a maintenance fee in 2019. This decision means that the drugs, used for diabetes and weight management, will no longer have patent protection in Canada, potentially opening the market to generic versions.
constructiveness_reason: This story is constructive as it provides useful information to readers about the revocation of Novo Nordisk's patent protection for its semaglutide drugs in Canada.
